output_text: {"id":"spec-audit-3step-plan","steps":[{"name":"Establish audit scope and success criteria","ok":true,"reason":"Identify the documentâ€™s purpose, target users, in/out of scope items, assumptions, constraints, and measurable acceptance criteria so the audit has a clear standard to evaluate against."},{"name":"Check completeness, consistency, and testability","ok":true,"reason":"Verify all requirements are unambiguous, uniquely identified, non-contradictory, and traceable; confirm edge cases, error handling, non-functional requirements (performance, security, accessibility, reliability), and dependencies are covered; ensure each requirement is testable with clear inputs/outputs."},{"name":"Validate feasibility and alignment with stakeholders","ok":true,"reason":"Review technical feasibility, architecture fit, data/API contracts, and operational considerations; run stakeholder review to confirm priorities and resolve gaps; produce an issues log with severity, proposed fixes, owners, and deadlines, then update the spec accordingly."}],"final":"Audit the spec by (1) defining scope and acceptance criteria, (2) verifying completeness/consistency/testability of all requirements, and (3) validating feasibility and stakeholder alignment while producing a prioritized issues log and updated spec."}
